alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 8:23AM CDT until May 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. For the Frenchman Creek...including Culbertson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM CDT Sunday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 08/11/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
